newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian stocks mixed, new market vigour expected.
newsitem.headline: Croatian stocks mixed, new market vigour expected.

text.p: Croatian stocks were mixed, with marginal losses among some of the blue chips, but traders expected the Zagreb Stock Exchange to regain its pre-summer vigour.
"Next week prices of market heavyweights could easily go up," one trader said, referring to drugs firm Pliva and Zagrebacka Banka.
Another trader said the market activity was almost totally dependent on Pliva's and Zagrebacka's trading in London.
"Their Zagreb prices always reflect developments in London. And then the two encourage trading in other issues," he said.
* Of eight active issues, one rose, one was flat and six fell.
* The only gainer Pliva added 100 kuna to close at 11,200 with 96 shares changing hands. Its GDRs were quoted lower on London Stock Exchange at $45.5 from Thursday's $46.
* Hotelier Laguna traded flat at 800 kuna with 87 shares sold.
* Most active Zagrebacka banka lost eight kuna to close at 682 kuna, with 7,660 shares sold. Its GDRs, trading at SEAQ International, were flat at $14.125.
* Hotelier Jadranturist inched down two kuna, closing at 158 on volume of 308 shares.
* Confectioner Kras lost five kuna, closing at 260 with 263 units sold.
* Food processor Podravka edged down five kuna to close at 225 kuna, selling 379 shares.
* Hotelier Suncani Hvar lost 5.6 kuna to close at 38.10, selling 646 shares and trading for the first time in more than a month.
* Privredna Banka closed at 140 kuna on volume of 515 shares. It last traded at 185.20 kuna in late January.
* Daily volume rose to 9,954 shares, turnover almost halved at 6.5 million kuna. Total weekly turnover three times higher at 43.8 million kuna.
* Central bank's exchange rate: 5.2556 kuna = $1. -- Laura Lui, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
